intro: Hieracium anomolepis, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, where it withstands cold and harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, with a rough, hairy texture, and its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Hieracium anomolepis is often found in open habitats such as meadows and mountain slopes.
